intro: Sphaeromeria potentilloides var. nitrophila, commonly known as the nitrophilous globular cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its small, rounded, succulent leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in nutrient-rich soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with edible or medicinal uses. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
